document.p: IPv6 forwarding table allows you to define basic accept rules to allow access to specific ports or hosts.

For more information, see Static leases
This section is not available when the device is switched to bridged mode..
The IPv6 forwarding table provides the following information:
document.li1:
Name
The name assigned to this forwarding rule.

Protocol
The protocol used to transmit the message.

Destination port:
The port to which the incoming message will be forwarded.
You can also type in (a part of) the name of the application or service (e.g. HTTP). The will then display a list of services with such a name. If you then click one of the results, the will insert the corresponding port number (e.g. 80).

Destination IP
The IP address to which the incoming message will be forwarded.
You can also type in (a part of) the host name of the device. The will then display a list of devices with such a host name. If you then click one of the results, the will insert the corresponding address.
document.p: Under the IPv6 forwarding table, click Add new rule mapping
